Name: Relief with Paste Inlays from the Tomb of Nefermaat
Description: This relief is from a lintel, or horizontal beam or stone above a door, and two doorjambs from the mastaba, or tomb, of Nefermaat. It is decorated with figures of the deceased and his family. The right jamb depicts the deceased standing with a rod in his hand. In another register, the wife of the deceased stands in front of three attendants. The left jamb shows Nefermaat standing with his attendants.
